quest.name: Highway Robbery
journal: Trachraet seeks an adventurer with superior sleuthing skills.

Lieutenant Trachraet reveals to you a troubling development: a Maelstrom convoy was recently intercepted, the unidentified perpetrators absconding with a vital shipment of saltpeter. He beseeches your aid, asking you to travel to Swiftperch in western La Noscea to assist Lieutenant Skaetswys, the officer tasked with leading the investigation.

Lieutenant Skaetswys is grateful for your assistance, as her subordinates have thus far not demonstrated much in the way of investigative skills. Search Swiftperch for the evidence which has thus far eluded her grasp.

A thorough scouring of Swiftperch has turned up a misshapen pickaxe of curious make. Could this be a tool left behind by the saltpeter thieves? Present it to Lieutenant Skaetswys in hopes that it sheds light on her inquiry.

Upon a close examination of the pick, Skaetswys is now convinced that the ambush of the convoy was carried out by a band of kobolds. Accompany Skaetswys to Camp Overlook and seek out Commander Bloeidin, whose vast knowledge of the tunnel-dwelling beastmen will prove vital in determining a proper course of action.

Upon your arrival at Camp Overlook, a captive kobold under interrogation by Commander Bloeidin is quick to confess that a notorious order of his kin, the 789th, were the masterminds behind the saltpeter theft. Exercising due caution, infiltrate their den of villainy and rendezvous once more with Skaetswys.

No sooner do you arrive at the dig and locate the stolen supplies than does the 789th Order sniff out your presence, quickly surrounding you. The mystery then deepens, however, when the vicious kobolds surrender the stolen goods with nary a fight. Speak with Skaetswys again, that the two of you might puzzle out exactly what has transpired.

Thoroughly confused by the kobolds' behavior, Skaetswys nonetheless elects to put off any further pondering until the supplies are safely conveyed to their original destination. Before setting off for Camp Overlook, she encourages you to explore the dig and seek out the leader of the 789th, that you might glean some knowledge of the surprisingly nonconfrontational kobolds.

The foreman of the 789th, an uninspiring kobold by the name of Gi Gu, sheepishly expresses his remorse for his order's actions, while insisting that they only stooped to common thievery due to extenuating circumstances. It would seem there is more to these kobolds' plight than meets the eye...
objectives: Search Swiftperch and the vicinity for clues.
Deliver the crooked pickaxe to Skaetswys.
Speak with Bloeidin at Camp Overlook.
Speak with Skaetswys at the 789th Order Dig.
Speak with 789th Order Pickman Gi Gu.

dialogue.name: TRACHRAET
dialogue.text: [GC Rank] SurnameForename! I know not what brings ye to Maelstrom Command this day, but I can 'ardly fault yer timin'. Aye, we've a situation on our 'ands, we do.

dialogue.name: TRACHRAET
dialogue.text: Not days ago, a convoy of ours was ambushed en route to Limsa, and a goodly shipment of saltpeter plundered from our very 'ands. The scurvy dogs responsible for the act struck swiftly and under darkness, so we've yet to figure out who they are─much less bring them to justice.

dialogue.name: TRACHRAET
dialogue.text: Saltpeter, as ye may know, is a key ingredient in fashionin' firesand. Whatever our foe might be plottin', like as not it involves an 'earty share o' fiery death and destruction.

dialogue.name: TRACHRAET
dialogue.text: Command has dispatched an elite regiment to the field to investigate, but clues 'ave proved 'arder to come by than an 'alf-decent pint of ale at sea.

dialogue.name: TRACHRAET
dialogue.text: Leadin' the investigation is a good comrade of mine. While I'd like nothin' more than to lend me strength to 'er search, I can't very well shirk me duties 'ere.

dialogue.name: TRACHRAET
dialogue.text: If ye find yerself itchin' for adventure, ye could do worse than to make for Swiftperch and seek out one Lieutenant Skaetswys. Just say that Trachraet sent ye.

dialogue.name: TRACHRAET
dialogue.text: A dear old comrade of mine leads the search for our missin' shipment of saltpeter. If ye be itchin' for adventure, make for Swiftperch and seek out one Lieutenant Skaetswys. Just say that Trachraet sent ye.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Llymlaen take the lot of ye! Ye'd 'ave me believe that there's not a single piece of evidence in this entire godsforsaken 'amlet!?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: And who might you be? An adventurer come on behalf of ol' Trachraet? Who said I was lookin' for 'elp, anyway?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Trachraet did? Hah! I'll 'ave ye both know that it's all clear skies and smooth sailin' 'ere. Aye, I was just about to file my report to─

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: ...Eh, I ain't foolin' no one. A good tonze o' saltpeter's been snatched from our 'ands, like as not by someone who'd use it to sink our fair Limsa to the bottom o' the sea. All right, I'll share with ye what me men 'ave gleaned, though I warn ye─it ain't much.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Given the scope o' the act, we believe it was a coordinated effort by a well-trained group. What's more, given the sheer speed with which the scurvy thieves vanished from our sight, I reckon that they 'ave knowledge o' passages unknown to us.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: I 'ad me 'opes up that my men would've found somethin', but they 'ad no such luck. What say ye? Care to take a look around and see if ye can find the evidence me 'alf-blind and thrice-daft subordinates couldn't?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: To steal off with all those crates with even our best men catchin' nary a glimpse... We're dealin' with a criminal band o' surpassin' skill an' chicanery.

dialogue.name: KOKKADANA01320
dialogue.text: <sigh> I'm in for a demotion for sure. How will I ever face me wife and kids again...?

dialogue.name: KOKKADANB01320
dialogue.text: Me eyes never left the wagon─I swear on me mother's grave! Well, I mean...maybe they did. Just for a moment... But Aleport was in clear sight! Can ye blame me for thinkin' we were safe?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Forename, was it? Well? Find any evidence that could shed some light on our investigation?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Hmmm...what 'ave we here? A pickaxe, and a rather sorry-lookin' one, at that. Do ye reckon this was left behind by the perpetrators?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: In my time with the Maelstrom, I've confronted just about every pirate, brigand, and 'ighwayman in these parts, but I've not known any of 'em to employ a tool like this.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: No, I'd wager more than a round at the Wench that our band o' grubby little thieves ain't no ordinary men. Aye, it's all becomin' clear to me...

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: ...And yerself, no doubt. Tell me, Forename─might ye be thinkin' what I'm thinkin'?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Are you thinking what Skaetswys is thinking? The culprit is...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: ...A rogue Roegadyn!?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: ...Those conniving kobolds!

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: None other! Aye, only a Roegadyn of abundant physical and mental talents─such as meself─could fashion and employ such an exquisite piece o'...

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: ...Do ye 'ave barnacles where yer brains should be, adventurer!? 'Cause if yer so much as implyin' that I staged the robbery meself, ye'll be takin' a long walk off a short pier the second you set foot back in Limsa!

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: ...I knew ye were a sharp one. Aye, the moment I laid eyes on that pickaxe ye found, me mind was convinced.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: The primitive make o' this tool, an all–too–'ealthy interest in explosives─all signs point to those rat–faced rapscallions bein' behind all this.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: It's so bloody obvious now that I could almost kick meself─and me good–for–nothin' men─for not comin' to this conclusion sooner.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: But this is 'ardly a time for whingin'. No, we must strike quickly if we mean to reclaim what's ours.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Camp Overlook is our front line o' defense against those tunnel-burrowin' thieves. If anyone 'as a notion o' where they've taken the saltpeter and 'ow they plan to use it, it'll be Commander Bloeidin.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: I'm off to deliver me report, but I've an 'unch our job has only begun. What say you come along, Forename? You're the first capable womanman I've worked with today.

dialogue.name: KOBOLDA01320
dialogue.text: Release me at once─free me, unhand me, release me!

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Hm? Make it quick, adventurer. As ye can see, I've got me hands full with our little friend here.

dialogue.name: KOBOLDA01320
dialogue.text: This is an outrage─a farce, an atrocity, an outrage! This is an insult, and we kobolds will not stand for it. No, no, stand no more!

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Ye'll not have legs to stand on if ye don't quit blabberin' an' spill the truth about whatever it is ye scurvy rats are plottin'!

dialogue.name: KOBOLDA01320
dialogue.text: Plotting? There is no plotting! No, no, we plot nothing─naught, nil, nothing!

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Enough! Unlike you and yer ilk, I've a workin' pair of eyes and at least half me wits about me. Ye think I've not seen you lot blastin' and scurryin' around U'Ghamaro of late!?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Commander Bloeidin, sir!

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Skaetswys? Aye, it's a treat to see me old trainee, but I fear a brewin' kobold plot demands me attention...

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Forename 'ere and I just might be able to 'elp ye with that, Commander. I trust ye've 'eard the news of our missin' shipment of saltpeter?

dialogue.name: KOBOLDA01320
dialogue.text: So soon she knows!? This cannot be! No, no, it cannot be!

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Hah, I knew it! Yer endless tongue-waggin' has finally dug yer own grave!

dialogue.name: KOBOLDA01320
dialogue.text: It was not us! No, no, not us. It was them─yes, yes, them!

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: What nonsense is this? Beady eyes, frizzy tail, a penchant for causin' us trouble─a kobold's a kobold!

dialogue.name: KOBOLDA01320
dialogue.text: This is not so! No, no, not so! There are kobolds, and then there are kobolds, and then there are kobolds still. It is the low ones who stole your precious saltpeter─the ones who live down, beneath, below!

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Beneath and below? ...Come to think of it, me scouts did mention a particularly scraggy band of kobolds what seem to have made their home at the cliff base.

dialogue.name: KOBOLDA01320
dialogue.text: Yes, yes! That is the place! That is the home, the home of the 789th. They are the worst─the worst of the worst. They are most stinky─smelly, scummy, stinky─and ugly, too!

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Commander! As the presidin' officer in this investigation, I request permission to go below and investigate the so-called 789th. Furthermore, I would enlist this adventurer to join me─she'e's proven 'erself'imself capable, and it would seem we go up against a worthy foe.

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: As ye please, Lieutenant. But I warn ye, be careful down there. The sight of a kobold won't strike fear into anyone's heart, but their bite─and their bombs─are a fair sight worse than their bark.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Understood, Commander─we'll not let ye down. And with that, I take my leave. Till sea swallows all!

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Well, Forename? Are ye ready to take on the scurviest band o' kobolds in La Noscea? Ye'd best be, because I'm countin' on ye to make yerself useful.

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Kobolds might look like little more than overgrown wharf rats, but their minds are as sharp as their claws. If you ever find yerself surrounded by 'em, ye'd best be ready for the fight o' yer life.

dialogue.name: KOBOLDA01320
dialogue.text: No good can come from dealing with the 789th. No good, no good at all. Ignore my words, and you are a fool─a dunce, a madwomanmadman, a fool.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Well, well... What 'ave we 'ere?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: One, two...aye, three crates o' saltpeter. It would seem our kobold informant spoke true.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: What the─!?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Surrounded!? Stand ready, Forename!

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Are ye just goin' to stand there squeakin' at me all nightday!? Fight with 'onor, or die like the rats ye are!

dialogue.name: GIGU
dialogue.text: (-Unimposing Kobold-)Ah, er...are there no alternatives─ch-choices, options, alternatives? Such as perhaps...surrender? Yes, yes, surrender! We surrender!

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Did you just say...surrender?

dialogue.name: KOBOLD01320
dialogue.text: (-789th Order Kobolds-)Yes, yes, we surrender─yield, submit, surrender!

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: What in the seven hells...?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: I 'aven't an inklin' as to the whys and wherefores, but it seems the notorious 789th is keen to return their plunder without so much as a fight.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: I, for one, wouldn't 'ave been opposed to crackin' a few kobold skulls, but considerin' the strained relations between Limsa and the little buggers these days, who can argue with good diplomacy?

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: Anyroad, I'll report back to Commander Bloeidin and arrange for the transport o' the supplies─aye, and with a reliable escort this time.

dialogue.name: SKAETSWYS
dialogue.text: In the meantime, why don't ye ask around and see what ye can learn about our new neighbors? After all, they don't seem 'alf as imposin' as I expected─their leader least of all... Best of luck, Forename. Till sea swallows all!

dialogue.name: GIGU
dialogue.text: Is the scary woman gone yet? Oh please, please say she is! You must forgive Gi Gu. Yes, Gi Gu and his friends naughty─wicked, nasty, naughty!

dialogue.name: GIGU
dialogue.text: Y-You are still here!? We have surrendered, yes? Yielded, submitted, surrendered? You will not hurt us, yes?

dialogue.name: GIGU
dialogue.text: ...Phew. I am relieved─reassured, relaxed, relieved. And who I am, you ask?

dialogue.name: GIGU
dialogue.text: I am Gi Gu, and Gi Gu is foreman of the 789th. Leader in name, yes, but no more. No, no, no more. For in truth, no one listens to Gi Gu. Gi Gu is ignored─invisible, insulted, ignored...incompetent, too.

dialogue.name: GIGU
dialogue.text: The 789th stole your precious boompowder? Yes, yes, we did. And yet, we had good cause for doing so─an excuse, a reason, a cause.

dialogue.name: GIGU
dialogue.text: Ours is a peaceful order by nature. The 789th troubled no one, and no one troubled us. No, not until now. Now we are driven from the tunnels, exiled to this place that stinks of soil and seawater.

dialogue.name: GIGU
dialogue.text: But you are a stranger, and I ramble too much, too soon. No, no, I will speak no more. Go now, and leave Gi Gu to his suffering─his pain, his shame, his suffering.
